title: COVID-19 in Poland
description: This blog focuses on the situation of COVID-19 in Poland as of August 31, 2021.
contents:
Data Description



Source of the Data: This report use one COVID-19 data from Our World in Data.
The raw data contains 62 variables, including daily number of COVID-19 cases, deaths and vaccine utilisation recorded by countries. This blog uses Poland as the research object to explore the infection and death of the new coronavirus in Poland, as well as the subsequent vaccination situation. The research timeline is from the first infection at 2020-03-04 to 2021-08-31. The details of data is shown below:
Data Dictionary:


Variable


Type


Description


date


date


The observation date


total_cases


double


Total number of confirmed cases of COVID-19


new_cases


double


The number of new cases per day


total_deaths


double


Total number of deaths of COVID-19


new_deaths


double


Total number of confirmed cases per million


total_cases_per_million


double


Total number of deaths per million


total_deaths_per_million


double


Total number of new deaths per day


total_vaccinations


double


Cumulative total vaccine doses administered


total_vaccinations_per_hundred


double


Cumulative total vaccine doses administered per 100 population


people_fully_vaccinated


double


Cumulative number of persons fully vaccinated


people_fully_vaccinated_per_hundred


double


Cumulative number of persons fully vaccinated per 100 population


Analysis and Exploration
Firstly, we see the last situation of COVID-19 cases and deaths at 2021-08-31 in Poland. The percentage of infections per million people is 7.64%, and The percentage of deaths per million people is 0.20.


Table 1: Last situation of COVID-19 in Poland





Cases




Deaths



date


total_cases


total_cases_per_million


total_deaths


total_deaths_per_million


2021-08-31


2,888,670


76425.91


75,345


1993.41


COVID-19 Cases in Poland
Then we focus on the specific average daily counts of cases and deaths by each month and the trend of corresponding variables.

class=\"display\">\n  <thead>\n    <tr>\n      <th> <\/th>\n      <th>Year<\/th>\n      <th>Month<\/th>\n      <th>New Cases (daily_avg)<\/th>\n      <th>New Cases Trend (monthly)<\/th>\n      <th>New Deaths (daily_avg)<\/th>\n      <th>New Deaths Trend (monthly)<\/th>\n    <\/tr>\n  <\/thead>\n<\/table>","options":{"pageLength":10,"columnDefs":[{"className":"dt-right","targets":[0,1,2,3,4,5,6]},{"orderable":false,"targets":0}],"fnDrawCallback":"\nfunction(){\n  HTMLWidgets.staticRender();\n}\n","order":[],"autoWidth":false,"orderClasses":false,"orderCellsTop":true}},"evals":["options.fnDrawCallback"],"jsHooks":[]}
From this table, the peaks of daily cases were in November 2020 and March 2021, and the highest average number of daily cases in November 2020 is 20936. However, the highest average number of daily deaths is at April 2021, approximately at 482.
According to the table above, we can see that the situation of COVID-19 in Poland declined from December 2020 to February 2021, but was followed by a repeat of the pandemic with monthly deaths surpassing the first wave. The main reasons for the resurgence of the pandemic are the re-emergence of the global outbreak since March 2021 and the emergence of multiple mutated strains in Europe. The Polish government extended the lockdown on March 15 in response to the worsening outbreak. The outbreak was brought under control in May, with the daily average number of new cases only 16.5% of April’s, and the death toll halved.
Numerical Summary Statistics
This correlation table contains the correlation coefficients which can give a overview and supply parameter values for analysis. The numerical summary is shown below:


Table 2: Numerical summary statistics of new coronavirus cases and deaths daily in Poland

Covid-19 Vaccination Status
The Polish vaccination began on 28 December 2020, and 36,232,370 doses had been administered by 30 August 2020.


html {
  font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Helvetica Neue', 'Fira Sans', 'Droid Sans', Arial, sans-serif;
}

#kyakngaglh .gt_table {
  display: table;
  border-collapse: collapse;
  margin-left: auto;
  margin-right: auto;
  color: #333333;
  font-size: 16px;
  font-weight: normal;
  font-style: normal;
  background-color: #FFFFFF;
  width: auto;
  border-top-style: solid;
  border-top-width: 2px;
  border-top-color: #A8A8A8;
  border-right-style: none;
  border-right-width: 2px;
  border-right-color: #D3D3D3;
  border-bottom-style: solid;
  border-bottom-width: 2px;
  border-bottom-color: #A8A8A8;
  border-left-style: none;
  border-left-width: 2px;
  border-left-color: #D3D3D3;
}

#kyakngaglh .gt_heading {
  background-color: #FFFFFF;
  text-align: center;
  border-bottom-color: #FFFFFF;
  border-left-style: none;
  border-left-width: 1px;
  border-left-color: #D3D3D3;
  border-right-style: none;
  border-right-width: 1px;
  border-right-color: #D3D3D3;
}

#kyakngaglh .gt_title {
  color: #333333;
  font-size: 125%;
  font-weight: initial;
  padding-top: 4px;
  padding-bottom: 4px;
  border-bottom-color: #FFFFFF;
  border-bottom-width: 0;
}

#kyakngaglh .gt_subtitle {
  color: #333333;
  font-size: 85%;
  font-weight: initial;
  padding-top: 0;
  padding-bottom: 6px;
  border-top-color: #FFFFFF;
  border-top-width: 0;
}

#kyakngaglh .gt_bottom_border {
  border-bottom-style: solid;
  border-bottom-width: 2px;
  border-bottom-color: #D3D3D3;
}

#kyakngaglh .gt_col_headings {
  border-top-style: solid;
  border-top-width: 2px;
  border-top-color: #D3D3D3;
  border-bottom-style: solid;
  border-bottom-width: 2px;
  border-bottom-color: #D3D3D3;
  border-left-style: none;
  border-left-width: 1px;
  border-left-color: #D3D3D3;
  border-right-style: none;
  border-right-width: 1px;
  border-right-color: #D3D3D3;
}

#kyakngaglh .gt_col_heading {
  color: #333333;
  background-color: #FFFFFF;
  font-size: 100%;
  font-weight: normal;
  text-transform: inherit;
  border-left-style: none;
  border-left-width: 1px;
  border-left-color: #D3D3D3;
  border-right-style: none;
  border-right-width: 1px;
  border-right-color: #D3D3D3;
  vertical-align: bottom;
  padding-top: 5px;
  padding-bottom: 6px;
  padding-left: 5px;
  padding-right: 5px;
  overflow-x: hidden;
}

#kyakngaglh .gt_column_spanner_outer {
  color: #333333;
  background-color: #FFFFFF;
  font-size: 100%;
  font-weight: normal;
  text-transform: inherit;
  padding-top: 0;
  padding-bottom: 0;
  padding-left: 4px;
  padding-right: 4px;
}

#kyakngaglh .gt_column_spanner_outer:first-child {
  padding-left: 0;
}

#kyakngaglh .gt_column_spanner_outer:last-child {
  padding-right: 0;
}

#kyakngaglh .gt_column_spanner {
  border-bottom-style: solid;
  border-bottom-width: 2px;
  border-bottom-color: #D3D3D3;
  vertical-align: bottom;
  padding-top: 5px;
  padding-bottom: 5px;
  overflow-x: hidden;
  display: inline-block;
  width: 100%;
}

#kyakngaglh .gt_group_heading {
  padding: 8px;
  color: #333333;
  background-color: #FFFFFF;
  font-size: 100%;
  font-weight: initial;
  text-transform: inherit;
  border-top-style: solid;
  border-top-width: 2px;
  border-top-color: #D3D3D3;
  border-bottom-style: solid;
  border-bottom-width: 2px;
  border-bottom-color: #D3D3D3;
  border-left-style: none;
  border-left-width: 1px;
  border-left-color: #D3D3D3;
  border-right-style: none;
  border-right-width: 1px;
  border-right-color: #D3D3D3;
  vertical-align: middle;
}

#kyakngaglh .gt_empty_group_heading {
  padding: 0.5px;
  color: #333333;
  background-color: #FFFFFF;
  font-size: 100%;
  font-weight: initial;
  border-top-style: solid;
  border-top-width: 2px;
  border-top-color: #D3D3D3;
  border-bottom-style: solid;
  border-bottom-width: 2px;
  border-bottom-color: #D3D3D3;
  vertical-align: middle;
}

#kyakngaglh .gt_from_md > :first-child {
  margin-top: 0;
}

#kyakngaglh .gt_from_md > :last-child {
  margin-bottom: 0;
}

#kyakngaglh .gt_row {
  padding-top: 8px;
  padding-bottom: 8px;
  padding-left: 5px;
  padding-right: 5px;
  margin: 10px;
  border-top-style: solid;
  border-top-width: 1px;
  border-top-color: #D3D3D3;
  border-left-style: none;
  border-left-width: 1px;
  border-left-color: #D3D3D3;
  border-right-style: none;
  border-right-width: 1px;
  border-right-color: #D3D3D3;
  vertical-align: middle;
  overflow-x: hidden;
}

#kyakngaglh .gt_stub {
  color: #333333;
  background-color: #FFFFFF;
  font-size: 100%;
  font-weight: initial;
  text-transform: inherit;
  border-right-style: solid;

  padding-left: 12px;
}

#kyakngaglh .gt_summary_row {
  color: #333333;
  background-color: #FFFFFF;
  text-transform: inherit;
  padding-top: 8px;
  padding-bottom: 8px;
  padding-left: 5px;
  padding-right: 5px;
}

#kyakngaglh .gt_first_summary_row {
  padding-top: 8px;
  padding-bottom: 8px;
  padding-left: 5px;
  padding-right: 5px;
  border-top-style: solid;
  border-top-width: 2px;
  border-top-color: #D3D3D3;
}

#kyakngaglh .gt_grand_summary_row {
  color: #333333;
  background-color: #FFFFFF;
  text-transform: inherit;
  padding-top: 8px;
  padding-bottom: 8px;
  padding-left: 5px;
  padding-right: 5px;
}

#kyakngaglh .gt_first_grand_summary_row {
  padding-top: 8px;
  padding-bottom: 8px;
  padding-left: 5px;
  padding-right: 5px;
  border-top-style: double;
  border-top-width: 6px;
  border-top-color: #D3D3D3;
}

#kyakngaglh .gt_striped {
  background-color: rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.05);
}

#kyakngaglh .gt_table_body {
  border-top-style: solid;
  border-top-width: 2px;
  border-top-color: #D3D3D3;
  border-bottom-style: solid;
  border-bottom-width: 2px;
  border-bottom-color: #D3D3D3;
}

#kyakngaglh .gt_footnotes {
  color: #333333;
  background-color: #FFFFFF;
  border-bottom-style: none;
  border-bottom-width: 2px;
  border-bottom-color: #D3D3D3;
  border-left-style: none;
  border-left-width: 2px;
  border-left-color: #D3D3D3;
  border-right-style: none;
  border-right-width: 2px;
  border-right-color: #D3D3D3;
}

#kyakngaglh .gt_footnote {
  margin: 0px;
  font-size: 90%;
  padding: 4px;
}

#kyakngaglh .gt_sourcenotes {
  color: #333333;
  background-color: #FFFFFF;
  border-bottom-style: none;
  border-bottom-width: 2px;
  border-bottom-color: #D3D3D3;
  border-left-style: none;
  border-left-width: 2px;

}

#kyakngaglh .gt_sourcenote {
  font-size: 90%;
  padding: 4px;
}

#kyakngaglh .gt_left {
  text-align: left;
}

#kyakngaglh .gt_center {
  text-align: center;
}

#kyakngaglh .gt_right {

#kyakngaglh .gt_font_normal {

}

#kyakngaglh .gt_footnote_marks {
  font-style: italic;
  font-weight: normal;
  font-size: 65%;
}

The number of vaccinations in Poland continues to increase. The total cumulative dose of vaccine per 100 people reached 95. and half of every 100 people have already been vaccinated. The duration of the second wave was shortened by continued vaccination, bringing the outbreak under control.

title: Welcome to My Blog
description:
Welcome to my blog, hope you enjoy 
reading what I have to say!
